Helping Families Seek Compensation For Child’s Injuries Caused By A Toy Or Product

Every year, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) issues warnings and recalls about dangerous toys and other children’s products.

Likewise, emergency room (ER) doctors report on toys and sports equipment (such as skateboards) that are often involved in injuries to children.

Parents seeking answers about injuries to their children caused by products made for children often turn to attorneys.

Child Safety Recalls: Cribs — Car Seats — Defective Children’s Beds

At Lamkin, Van Eman, Trimble & Dougherty, LLC, we advise parents in and around Columbus, Ohio, about how to seek compensation for injuries, pain and suffering after an injury caused by a dangerous toy or other children’s product.

Our lawyers have successfully represented clients in injury cases involving children’s products such as:

  • Toy tractors
  • Children’s weapons (arrows or guns marketed for children)
  • Child-sized motorized cars
  • Electrical toys that caught fire
  • Cribs and high chairs that malfunctioned or did not protect a child as designed

Injuries Caused By Children’s Products Not On A Recall List

Not all dangerous toys and children’s products have appeared in child product recalls. Whether or not your child’s toy or product was on a list of dangerous products, we encourage you to talk to an attorney about how to pursue compensation for:

  • Medical bills
  • Psychological therapy
  • Pain and suffering

Contact Our Team To Learn More About Your Legal Options

When you look for a lawyer to help after your child has been injured, reach out to our team.

Since 1968, our plaintiffs law firm has advocated for injured adults and children. Whether or not the toy or product involved in your child’s injury was on a safety recall list, we may be able to recover compensation for you from:

  • The manufacturer of the product
  • The seller of the product
  • A day care facility that failed to keep your child safe

Call 614-360-2706 Today. Free Consultations.

Entrust your injury case to our skilled and experienced attorneys. Call or send us an email to set up an appointment. We offer free consults and contingency fee arrangements.
